name: stridently
content:
stridently adverb
(forcefully)
Add to word list
Add to word list
forcefully, and in language that does not try to avoid upsetting other people: She has always stridently denied the accusations against her. He is stridently opposed to abortion.
More examplesFewer examplesHis message is stridently anti-war.Being stridently feminist, I had more than a few arguments with my boyfriend.At times they seem intoxicated with their own moral outrage, and they express it stridently.

stridently adverb
(loudly)
in a way that sounds loud, unpleasant, and rough in sound: He whistled, shouted, and laughed stridently. She delivers her words stridently, savouring every syllable and hammering home the melodies.
More examplesFewer examplesHe sounded the horn stridently.The singer was trying too hard, pushing her voice too stridently.Stridently he sings "Three Blind Mice."
